00036 class RpcException(Exception):
00037         def __init__(self, code, backtrace):
00038 
00039                 self.code = code
00040                 self.args = backtrace
00041                 if hasattr(code, 'split'):
00042                         lines = code.split('\n')
00043         
00044                         self.type = lines[0].split(' -- ')[0]
00045                         self.message = ''
00046                         if len(lines[0].split(' -- ')) > 1:
00047                                 self.message = lines[0].split(' -- ')[1]
00048         
00049                         self.data = '\n'.join(lines[2:])
00050                 else:
00051                         self.type = 'error'
00052                         self.message = backtrace
00053                         self.data = backtrace
00054 
00055                 self.backtrace = backtrace

00057 ## @brief The Connection class provides an abstract interface for a RPC
00058 # protocol
00059 class Connection:
00060         def __init__(self, url):
00061                 self.authorized = False
00062                 self.databaseName = None
00063                 self.uid = None
00064                 self.password = None
00065                 self.url = url
00066 
00067         def convert(self, result): 
00068                 if isinstance(result, str):
00069                         return unicode( result, 'utf-8' )
00070                 elif isinstance(result, list):
00071                         return map(self.convert, result)
00072                 elif isinstance(result, tuple):
00073                         return map(self.convert, result)
00074                 elif isinstance(result, dict):
00075                         newres = {}
00076                         for i in result.keys():
00077                                 newres[i] = self.convert(result[i])
00078                         return newres
00079                 else:
00080                         return result
00081 
00082         def connect(self, database, uid, password):
00083                 self.databaseName = database
00084                 self.uid = uid
00085                 self.password = password
00086 
00087         def call(self, url, method, *args ):
00088                 pass
00089 
00090 modules = []
00091 try:
00092         import Pyro.core
00093         modules.append( 'pyro' )
00094 except:
00095         pass

00097 ## @brief The PyroConnection class implements Connection for the Pyro RPC protocol.
00098 #
00099 # The Pyro protocol is usually opened at port 8071 on the server.
00100 class PyroConnection(Connection):
00101         def __init__(self, url):
00102                 Connection.__init__(self, url)
00103                 self.url += '/rpc'
00104                 self.proxy = Pyro.core.getProxyForURI( self.url )
00105 
00106         def singleCall(self, obj, method, *args):
00107                 if self.authorized:
00108                         result = self.proxy.dispatch( obj[1:], method, self.databaseName, self.uid, self.password, *args )
00109                 else:
00110                         result = self.proxy.dispatch( obj[1:], method, *args )
00111                 return self.convert( result )
00112 
00113         def call(self, obj, method, *args):
00114                 try:
00115                         #import traceback
00116                         #traceback.print_stack()
00117                         #print "CALLING: ", obj, method, args
00118                         result = self.singleCall( obj, method, *args )
00119                 except (Pyro.errors.ConnectionClosedError, Pyro.errors.ProtocolError), x:
00120                         # As Pyro is a statefull protocol, network errors
00121                         # or server reestarts will cause errors even if the server
00122                         # is running and available again. So if remote call failed 
00123                         # due to network error or server restart, try to bind 
00124                         # and make the call again.
00125                         self.proxy = Pyro.core.getProxyForURI( self.url )
00126                         result = self.singleCall( obj, method, *args )
00127                 return result
00128 
00129 ## @brief The SocketConnection class implements Connection for the OpenERP socket RPC protocol.
00130 #
00131 # The socket RPC protocol is usually opened at port 8070 on the server.
00132 class SocketConnection(Connection):
00133         def call(self, obj, method, *args):
00134                 s = tiny_socket.mysocket()
00135                 s.connect( self.url )
00136                 # Remove leading slash (ie. '/object' -> 'object')
00137                 obj = obj[1:]
00138                 if self.authorized:
00139                         s.mysend((obj, method, self.databaseName, self.uid, self.password)+args)
00140                 else:
00141                         s.mysend((obj, method)+args)
00142                 result = s.myreceive()
00143                 s.disconnect()
00144                 return self.convert( result )
00145 
00146 ## @brief The XmlRpcConnection class implements Connection class for XML-RPC.
00147 #
00148 # The XML-RPC communication protocol is usually opened at port 8069 on the server.
00149 class XmlRpcConnection(Connection):
00150         def __init__(self, url):
00151                 Connection.__init__(self, url)
00152                 self.url += '/xmlrpc'
00153 
00154         def call(self, obj, method, *args ):
00155                 remote = xmlrpclib.ServerProxy(self.url + obj)
00156                 function = getattr(remote, method)
00157                 if self.authorized:
00158                         result = function(self.databaseName, self.uid, self.password, *args)
00159                 else:
00160                         result = function( *args )
00161                 return result
00162 
00163 ## @brief Creates an instance of the appropiate Connection class.
00164 #
00165 # These can be:
00166 # - SocketConnection if protocol (or scheme) is socket:// 
00167 # - PyroConnection if protocol 
00168 # - XmlRpcConnection otherwise (usually will be http or https)
00169 def createConnection(url):
00170         qUrl = QUrl( url )
00171         if qUrl.scheme() == 'socket':
00172                 con = SocketConnection( url )
00173         elif qUrl.scheme() == 'PYROLOC':
00174                 con = PyroConnection( url )
00175         else:
00176                 con = XmlRpcConnection( url )
00177         return con
00178 
00179 class AsynchronousSessionCall(QThread):
00180         def __init__(self, session, parent=None):
00181                 QThread.__init__(self, parent)
00182                 self.session = session.copy()
00183                 self.obj = None
00184                 self.method = None
00185                 self.args = None
00186                 self.result = None
00187                 self.callback = None
00188                 self.error = None
00189                 self.warning = None
00190                 self.exception = None
00191                 # If false, the behaviour is the same as Session.call()
00192                 # otherwise we use the notification mechanism and behave
00193                 # like Session.execute()
00194                 self.useNotifications = False
00195 
00196         def execute(self, callback, obj, method, *args):
00197                 self.useNotifications = True
00198                 self.exception = None
00199                 self.callback = callback
00200                 self.obj = obj
00201                 self.method = method
00202                 self.args = args
00203                 self.connect( self, SIGNAL('finished()'), self.hasFinished )
00204                 self.start()
00205 
00206         def call(self, callback, obj, method, *args):
00207                 self.useNotifications = False
00208                 self.exception = None
00209                 self.callback = callback
00210                 self.obj = obj
00211                 self.method = method
00212                 self.args = args
00213                 self.connect( self, SIGNAL('finished()'), self.hasFinished )
00214                 self.start()
00215 
00216         def hasFinished(self):
00217                 if self.exception:
00218                         if self.useNotifications:
00219                                 # Note that if there's an error or warning
00220                                 # callback is called anyway with value None
00221                                 if self.error:
00222                                         Notifier.notifyError(*self.error)
00223                                 elif self.warning:
00224                                         Notifier.notifyWarning(*self.warning)
00225                                 else: 
00226                                         raise self.exception
00227                         self.emit( SIGNAL('exception(PyQt_PyObject)'), self.exception )
00228                 else:
00229                         self.emit( SIGNAL('called(PyQt_PyObject)'), self.result )
00230 
00231                 if self.callback:
00232                         self.callback( self.result, self.exception )
00233 
00234         def run(self):
00235                 # As we don't want to force initialization of gettext if 'call' is used
00236                 # we handle exceptions depending on 'useNotifications' 
00237                 if not self.useNotifications:
00238                         try:
00239                                 self.result = self.session.call( self.obj, self.method, *self.args )
00240                         except Exception, err:
00241                                 self.exception = err
00242                 else:
00243                         try:
00244                                 self.result = self.session.call( self.obj, self.method, *self.args )
00245                         except socket.error, err:
00246                                 self.exception = err
00247                                 self.error = (_('Connection Refused'), unicode(err), unicode(err))
00248                         except xmlrpclib.Fault, err:
00249                                 self.exception = err
00250                                 a = RpcException(err.faultCode, err.faultString)
00251                                 if a.type in ('warning','UserError'):
00252                                         self.warning = (a.message, a.data)
00253                                 else:
00254                                         self.error = (_('Application Error'), _('View details'), err.faultString)
00255                         except tiny_socket.Myexception, err:
00256                                 self.exception = err
00257                                 faultCode = unicode( err.faultCode, 'utf-8' )
00258                                 faultString = unicode( err.faultString, 'utf-8' )
00259                                 a = RpcException( faultCode, faultString )
00260                                 if a.type in ('warning','UserError'):
00261                                         self.warning = (a.message, a.data)
00262                                 else:
00263                                         self.error = (_('Application Error'), _('View details'), faultString)
00264                         except Exception, err:
00265                                 self.exception = err
00266                                 notified = False
00267                                 if 'pyro' in modules:
00268                                         if Pyro.util.getPyroTraceback(err):
00269                                                 notified = True
00270                                                 faultCode = err.message
00271                                                 faultString = u''.join( Pyro.util.getPyroTraceback(err) )
00272                                                 a = RpcException( faultCode, faultString )
00273                                                 if a.type in ('warning','UserError'):
00274                                                         self.warning = (a.message, a.data)
00275                                                 else:
00276                                                         self.error = (_('Application Error'), _('View details'), faultString)
00277                                 if not notified:
00278                                         faultString = unicode( err )
00279                                         self.error = (_('Application Error'), _('View details'), faultString)

00282 ## @brief The Session class provides a simple way of login and executing function in a server
00283 #
00284 # Typical usage of Session:
00285 #
00286 # \code
00287 # from Koo import Rpc
00288 # Rpc.session.login('http://admin:admin\@localhost:8069', 'database')
00289 # attached = Rpc.session.execute('/object', 'execute', 'ir.attachment', 'read', [1,2,3])
00290 # Rpc.session.logout()
00291 # \endcode
00292 class Session:
00293         LoggedIn = 1
00294         Exception = 2
00295         InvalidCredentials = 3
00296         
00297         def __init__(self):
00298                 self.open = False
00299                 self.url = None
00300                 self.password = None
00301                 self.uid = None
00302                 self.context = {}
00303                 self.userName = None
00304                 self.databaseName = None
00305                 self.connection = None
00306                 self.cache = None
00307                 self.threads = []
00308 
00309         # This function removes all finished threads from the list of running
00310         # threads and appends the one provided.
00311         # We keep a reference to all threads started because otherwise their
00312         # C++ counterparts would be freed by garbage collector. User can also
00313         # keep a reference to it when she calls callAsync or executeAsync but
00314         # with this mechanism she's not forced to it.
00315         # The only inconvenience we could find is that we kept some thread
00316         # objects for much too long in memory, but that doesn't seem worrisome
00317         # by now.
00318         def appendThread(self, thread):
00319                 self.threads = [x for x in self.threads if x.isRunning()]
00320                 self.threads.append( thread )
00321 
00322         ## @brief Calls asynchronously the specified method on the given object on the server.
00323         # 
00324         # When the response to the request arrives the callback function is called with the
00325         # returned value as the first parameter. It returns an AsynchronousSessionCall instance 
00326         # that can be used to keep track to what query a callback refers to, consider that as
00327         # a call id.
00328         # If there is an error during the call it simply rises an exception. See 
00329         # execute() if you want exceptions to be handled by the notification mechanism.
00330         # @param callback Function that has to be called when the result returns from the server.
00331         # @param exceptionCallback Function that has to be called when an exception returns from the server.
00332         # @param obj Object name (string) that contains the method
00333         # @param method Method name (string) to call 
00334         # @param args Argument list for the given method
00335         # 
00336         # Example of usage:
00337         # \code
00338         # from Koo import Rpc
00339         # def returned(self, value):
00340         #       print value
00341         # Rpc.session.login('http://admin:admin\@localhost:8069', 'database')
00342         # Rpc.session.post( returned, '/object', 'execute', 'ir.attachment', 'read', [1,2,3]) 
00343         # Rpc.session.logout()
00344         # \endcode
00345         def callAsync( self, callback, exceptionCallback, obj, method, *args ):
00346                 caller = AsynchronousSessionCall( self )
00347                 caller.call( callback, obj, method, *args )
00348                 self.appendThread( caller )
00349                 return caller
00350 
00351         ## @brief Same as callAsync() but uses the notify mechanism to notify
00352         # exceptions. 
00353         #
00354         # Note that you'll need to bind gettext as texts sent to
00355         # the notify module are localized.
00356         def executeAsync( self, callback, obj, method, *args ):
00357                 caller = AsynchronousSessionCall( self )
00358                 caller.execute( callback, obj, method, *args )
00359                 self.appendThread( caller )
00360                 return caller
00361 
00362         ## @brief Calls the specified method
00363         # on the given object on the server. 
00364         #
00365         # If there is an error during the call it simply rises an exception. See 
00366         # execute() if you want exceptions to be handled by the notification mechanism.
00367         # @param obj Object name (string) that contains the method
00368         # @param method Method name (string) to call 
00369         # @param args Argument list for the given method
00370         def call(self, obj, method, *args):
00371                 if self.cache:
00372                         if self.cache.exists( obj, method, *args ):
00373                                 return self.cache.get( obj, method, *args )
00374                 value = self.connection.call(obj, method, *args)
00375                 if self.cache:
00376                         self.cache.add( value, obj, method, *args )
00377                 return value
00378 
00379         ## @brief Same as call() but uses the notify mechanism to notify
00380         # exceptions. 
00381         #
00382         # Note that you'll need to bind gettext as texts sent to
00383         # the notify module are localized.
00384         def execute(self, obj, method, *args):
00385                 if not self.open:
00386                         raise RpcException(1, 'not logged')
00387                 try:
00388                         return self.call(obj, method, *args)
00389                 except socket.error, err:
00390                         Notifier.notifyError(_('Connection Refused'), unicode(err), unicode(err) )
00391                 except xmlrpclib.Fault, err:
00392                         a = RpcException(err.faultCode, err.faultString)
00393                         if a.type in ('warning','UserError'):
00394                                 if a.message in ('ConcurrencyException') and len(args) > 4:
00395                                         if Notifier.notifyConcurrencyError(args[0], args[2][0], args[4]):
00396                                                 if 'read_delta' in args[4]:
00397                                                         del args[4]['read_delta']
00398                                                 return self.execute(obj, method, *args)
00399                                 else:
00400                                         Notifier.notifyWarning(a.message, a.data )
00401                         else:
00402                                 Notifier.notifyError(_('Application Error'), _('View details'), err.faultString)
00403                 except tiny_socket.Myexception, err:
00404                         faultCode = unicode( err.faultCode, 'utf-8' )
00405                         faultString = unicode( err.faultString, 'utf-8' )
00406                         a = RpcException( faultCode, faultString )
00407                         if a.type in ('warning','UserError'):
00408                                 if a.message in ('ConcurrencyException') and len(args) > 4:
00409                                         if Notifier.notifyConcurrencyError(args[0], args[2][0], args[4]):
00410                                                 if 'read_delta' in args[4]:
00411                                                         del args[4]['read_delta']
00412                                                 return self.execute(obj, method, *args)
00413                                 else:
00414                                         Notifier.notifyWarning(a.message, a.data )
00415                         else:
00416                                 Notifier.notifyError(_('Application Error'), _('View details'), faultString)
00417                 except Exception, err:
00418                         notified = False
00419                         if 'pyro' in modules:
00420                                 if Pyro.util.getPyroTraceback(err):
00421                                         notified = True
00422                                         faultCode = err.message
00423                                         faultString = u''
00424                                         for x in Pyro.util.getPyroTraceback(err):
00425                                                 faultString += unicode( x, 'utf-8', errors='ignore' )
00426                                         a = RpcException( faultCode, faultString )
00427                                         if a.type in ('warning','UserError'):
00428                                                 if a.message in ('ConcurrencyException') and len(args) > 4:
00429                                                         if Notifier.notifyConcurrencyError(args[0], args[2][0], args[4]):
00430                                                                 if 'read_delta' in args[4]:
00431                                                                         del args[4]['read_delta']
00432                                                                 return self.execute(obj, method, *args)
00433                                                 else:
00434                                                         Notifier.notifyWarning(a.message, a.data )
00435                                         else:
00436                                                 Notifier.notifyError(_('Application Error'), _('View details'), faultString)
00437 
00438                         if not notified:
00439                                 faultString = unicode( err )
00440                                 Notifier.notifyError(_('Application Error'), _('View details'), faultString)
00441                         
00442 
00443         ## @brief Logs in the given server with specified name and password.
00444         # @param url url string such as 'http://admin:admin\@localhost:8069'. 
00445         # Admited protocols are 'http', 'https' and 'socket'
00446         # @param db string with the database name 
00447         # Returns -1 if an exception occurred while trying to contact the server.
00448         # Returns -2 if the login information was refused by the server.
00449         def login(self, url, db):
00450                 url = QUrl( url )
00451                 _url = str( url.scheme() ) + '://' + str( url.host() ) + ':' + str( url.port() ) 
00452                 self.connection = createConnection( _url )
00453                 user = unicode( url.userName() )
00454                 password = unicode( url.password() )
00455                 try:
00456                         res = self.connection.call( '/common', 'login', db, user, password )
00457                 except socket.error, e:
00458                         return Session.Exception
00459                 if not res:
00460                         self.open=False
00461                         self.uid=False
00462                         return Session.InvalidCredentials
00463 
00464                 self.url = _url
00465                 self.open = True
00466                 self.uid = res
00467                 self.userName = user
00468                 self.password = password
00469                 self.databaseName = db
00470                 if self.cache:
00471                         self.cache.clear()
00472                 
00473                 self.connection.databaseName = self.databaseName
00474                 self.connection.password = self.password
00475                 self.connection.uid = self.uid
00476                 self.connection.authorized = True
00477 
00478                 self.reloadContext()
00479                 return Session.LoggedIn
00480 
00481         ## @brief Reloads the session context
00482         #
00483         # Useful when some user parameters such as language are changed.
00484         def reloadContext(self):
00485                 self.context = self.execute('/object', 'execute', 'res.users', 'context_get') or {}
00486 
00487         ## @brief Returns whether the login function has been called and was successfull
00488         def logged(self):
00489                 return self.open
00490 
00491         ## @brief Logs out of the server.
00492         def logout(self):
00493                 if self.open:
00494                         self.open = False
00495                         self.userName = None
00496                         self.uid = None
00497                         self.password = None
00498                         if self.cache:
00499                                 self.cache.clear()
00500 
00501         ## @brief Uses eval to evaluate the expression, using the defined context
00502         # plus the appropiate 'uid' in it.
00503         def evaluateExpression(self, expression, context={}):
00504                 context['uid'] = self.uid
00505                 if isinstance(expression, basestring):
00506                         return eval(expression, context)
00507                 else:
00508                         return expression 
00509 
00510         def copy(self):
00511                 new = Session()
00512                 new.open = self.open 
00513                 new.url = self.url 
00514                 new.password = self.password
00515                 new.uid = self.uid
00516                 new.context = self.context
00517                 new.userName = self.userName
00518                 new.databaseName = self.databaseName 
00519                 # Create a new connection as Pyro protocol does not allow the use of
00520                 # the same connection in different threads and this copy() function
00521                 # will mostly be called to use the session in new threads.
00522                 new.connection = createConnection( new.url )
00523                 new.connection.databaseName = self.databaseName
00524                 new.connection.password = self.password
00525                 new.connection.uid = self.uid
00526                 new.connection.authorized = True
00527                 return new

00529 session = Session()
00530 session.cache = ActionViewCache()

00532 ## @brief The Database class handles queries that don't require a previous login, served by the db server object
00533 class Database:
00534         ## @brief Obtains the list of available databases from the given URL. None if there 
00535         # was an error trying to fetch the list.
00536         def list(self, url):
00537                 try:
00538                         return self.call( url, 'list' )
00539                 except:
00540                         return -1
00541 
00542         ## @brief Calls the specified method
00543         # on the given object on the server. If there is an error
00544         # during the call it simply rises an exception
00545         def call(self, url, method, *args):
00546                 con = createConnection( url )
00547                 return con.call( '/db', method, *args )
00548 
00549         ## @brief Same as call() but uses the notify mechanism to notify 
00550         # exceptions.
00551         def execute(self, url, method, *args):
00552                 res = False
00553                 try:
00554                         res = self.call(url, method, *args)
00555                 except socket.error, msg:
00556                         Notifier.notifyWarning('', _('Could not contact server!') )
00557                 return res
00558 
00559 database = Database()

00561 ## @brief The RpcProxy class allows wrapping a server object only by giving it's name.
00562 # 
00563 # For example: 
00564 # obj = RpcProxy('ir.values')
00565 class RpcProxy(object):
00566         def __init__(self, resource):
00567                 self.resource = resource
00568                 self.__attrs = {}
00569 
00570         def __getattr__(self, name):
00571                 if not name in self.__attrs:
00572                         self.__attrs[name] = RpcFunction(self.resource, name)
00573                 return self.__attrs[name]
00574         
00575 
00576 class RpcFunction(object):
00577         def __init__(self, object, func_name):
00578                 self.object = object
00579                 self.func = func_name
00580 
00581         def __call__(self, *args):
00582                 return session.execute('/object', 'execute', self.object, self.func, *args)
